article.Heading: Budget 2016: To boost computers in villages, digital land records relaunched
article.Summary: Under the scheme, the government expects to bring broadband in 2.5 lakh villages and universal phone connectivity by 2019. It also wants to create around 1.7 crore direct jobs and around 8.5 crore indirect jobs in the next four years.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

In his budget speech, FM Arun Jaitley announced the National Digital Literacy Mission Scheme under Digital India. The scheme will try to decrease the number of households without a computer in rural areas by half to 6 crore. Also, the government will relaunch its national land record digitisation scheme and fund it with Rs 150 crore.

With the launch of Digital India last year, the government plans to transform the country into a digitally empowered knowledge economy. It includes various schemes like the Digital Locker, e-education, e-health, e-sign and a national scholarship portal.

Under the scheme, the government expects to bring broadband in 2.5 lakh villages and universal phone connectivity by 2019. It also wants to create around 1.7 crore direct jobs and around 8.5 crore indirect jobs in the next four years.
